result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey E Szuta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.  
All court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9); also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey E Szuta

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: SENTENCING Transcript commencing 06-09-2017 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF002569 (24 Pages). CH
Due date based on this case and 15CF2569.

Defendant Jeffrey E Szuta in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Jeffrey E Szuta in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to ONE HUNDRED (100) DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for ONE HUNDRED (100) DAYS time served;  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9).  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Jeffrey E Szuta in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Jeffrey E Szuta in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State moved to REVOKE.  Defense and Defendant conceded thatt there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey E Szuta in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Jeffrey E Szuta in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
By agreement of the Parties,  matter is rescheduled to 01-27-2016 at 02:30pm.  sdg

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets bail of $5,000.00.
